author: NewsBreak Original
title: Police investigate South Toledo drive-by shooting as homicide
text: An apparent drive-by shooting in South Toledo left a man dead Thursday, authorities said. The shooting occurred about 10:30 a.m. in the 2400 block of Broadway, Toledo police said at the scene. Mark Overton, 35, who police said suffered at least one gunshot wound, was pronounced dead at the University of Toledo Medical Center, the former Medical College of Ohio Hospital, according to a police report. No suspect had been identified. Circumstances leading to the shooting remained under investigation. Overton appeared to have been driving south on Broadway when the shooting occurred, Sgt. Roy Kennedy said. After he was shot, the SUV continued about 200 yards before the driver lost control of the vehicle and crashed into a parked car on the northbound side of Broadway. Police believe Overton was alone in the vehicle and no one else appears to have been injured, Sergeant Kennedy said. Bullet holes were visible in the hood and passenger side front window of the SUV. The death was being investigated as a homicide, which would be the 43rd of 2023 in Toledo . An official cause of death is pending an autopsy by the Lucas County Coroner’s Office. “This is outrageous, this is unacceptable,” Toledo city councilman Cerssandra McPherson said about gun violence continuing in the city in broad daylight. “...There’s no quick fix, but we gotta get these guns off the streets.” Traffic was blocked off along Broadway near Lorain Street on Thursday afternoon as authorities continued their work. Anyone with information is asked to call or text the Crime Stopper program at 419-255-1111. Callers may remain anonymous and could be eligible for a reward. Subscribe to The Blade

author: Donald Kendal; Jim Lakely; Christopher Talgo
title: Trump Faces 20 Years in Prison!? - In The Tank #452 - The Heartland Institute
text: The Heartland Institute’s Donald Kendal, Jim Lakely, and Chris Talgo present episode 452 of the In The Tank Podcast. In the hours after our show ended last week, the verdicts began rolling in for former President Donald Trump’s “hush money” case – 34 convictions. We are truly in unprecedented territory. What does this mean for Trump? What does this mean for the election? And most importantly, what does this mean for America? Also, a new report was released that shines even more light on the Covid lab leak theory and the role the United States played in funding that research. PRIMARY TOPIC – TRUMP FACES 20-YEAR PRISON SENTENCE!? The Washington Post – Trump’s New York trial is over. What’s next with his other criminal cases? The Hill – Trump to be sentenced just 4 days before GOP convention [https://thehill.com/regulation/court-battles/4694696-trump-to-be-sentenced-just-four-days-before-gop-convention/](https://thehill.com/regulation/court-battles/4694696-trump-to-be-sentenced-just-four-days-before-gop-convention/) DNYUZ – The G.O.P. Push for Post-Verdict Payback: ‘Fight Fire With Fire’ WSJ – Behind Closed Doors, Biden Shows Signs of Slipping [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/behind-closed-doors-biden-shows-signs-of-slipping/ar-BB1nDMKT](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/behind-closed-doors-biden-shows-signs-of-slipping/ar-BB1nDMKT) SECONDARY TOPIC – LAB LEAK REPORT EXPOSES US FUNDING NYP – Damning new report finds China lab leak most likely source of COVID-19 — and blames US for pumping millions into the dangerous research NYT – Why the Pandemic Probably Started in a Lab, in 5 Key Points The Federalist – Fauci Admits There Was No Scientific Evidence For Six-Foot Social Distancing Rule [https://thefederalist.com/2024/06/04/fauci-admits-there-was-no-scientific-evidence-for-six-foot-social-distancing-rule/](https://thefederalist.com/2024/06/04/fauci-admits-there-was-no-scientific-evidence-for-six-foot-social-distancing-rule/) Fox News – Dr. Deborah Birx admits there was an effort to squash COVID lab leak theory (video) Chris Cuomo debate “find the clips”

author: José María López
title: Otro drama en la defensa del Betis: Chadi Riad va a la CAN - AS.com
text: Otro drama en la defensa del Betis: Chadi Riad va a la CAN Walid Regragui, seleccionador de Marruecos, convoca al central verdiblanco para la Copa de África que se disputará en Costa de Marfil. Problema gordo para el Betis y su defensa. Uno más esta temporada. Los peores presagios se han confirmado y tras aparecer en la prelista de Marruecos para la Copa de África, Chadi Riad ha sido citado oficialmente para formar parte del equipo que estará en Costa de Marfil a comienzos de este 2024. El notable rendimiento de central verdiblanco no ha pasado desapercibido para Walid Regragui, seleccionador del combinado marroquí. De este modo, Chadi Riad podrá debutar oficialmente con el combinado absoluto de su país después de haber sido un habitual en las convocatorias de la selección sub 23. Luicirá el dorsal número 18. De este modo, Manuel Pellegrini sólo podrá contar con Pezzella y Sokratis como centrales puros mientras Marruecos siga vivo en el torneo. La opción de Marc Roca como defensor dejará de ser una solución de emergencia en Europa y también tendrá que estar presente en el campeonato liguero y en la Copa del Rey. Ahora, el Betis trabajará para que Chadi Riad, al menos, pueda estar contra el Celta el próximo 3 de enero. Tal y como se esperaba, Abde también forma parte de la convocatoria de Marruecos, así como el delantero del Sevilla En Nesyri. Sigue el [canal de Diario AS en WhatsApp](https://www.whatsapp.com/channel/0029VaAasdA7j6g745nz9M10), donde encontrarás todas las claves deportivas del día. Para poder comentar debes estar registrado y haber iniciado sesión. [¿Olvidaste la contraseña?](https://asfan.as.com/recontrasena/?backURL=https%3A%2F%2Fas.com%2F&o=COMAS&prod=REGhttps%3A%2F%2Fas.com%2F)
